verdict.bottomLine: Synthesia is best for training, internal comms, and product explainers needing reliable 1080p MP4 exports. The trade-off is restrictions: freemium videos are watermarked and require re-generation after upgrading, stock avatars cannot be used for paid promotion, and refund policies vary by customer type. User reports suggest moderation can be strict and generation may stall.

faqs.question: Do Freemium videos have a watermark?
faqs.answer: Yes—the Synthesia logo watermark appears on all videos created with a Freemium account. To publish without it, you'll need a paid plan and re-generate the video.

faqs.question: Can I remove the watermark without paying?
faqs.answer: No—removal requires upgrading and re-generating the video. Exporting the same Freemium video again will still include the watermark.

faqs.question: What resolution are standard MP4 downloads?
faqs.answer: Standard MP4 downloads export in Full HD 1080p (1920×1080). This is explicitly stated in Synthesia's download instructions.

faqs.question: What file formats can I export?
faqs.answer: Synthesia supports MP4, WAV, XLIFF, and captions in SRT and VTT formats. Pick the format based on whether you need video, audio, or localization/captions.

faqs.question: Can I download videos that include interactive elements?
faqs.answer: No—videos with interactive elements cannot be downloaded as MP4. If downloading is required, avoid interactive features in that project.

faqs.question: Is commercial use allowed?
faqs.answer: Commercial use is allowed with restrictions, especially around paid promotion when using stock avatars. Paid TV/social ads using stock avatars are listed as not allowed.

faqs.question: Do I get a license to use Synthesia's built-in content?
faqs.answer: Yes—Synthesia states it grants a perpetual license for integrated content used within created videos. This applies to content you include through the platform into your outputs.

faqs.question: What are the system requirements?
faqs.answer: Synthesia requires modern browsers (e.g., Chrome 133+ and Edge 134+) and supported OS versions (Windows 10+ or macOS Catalina 10.15+). If you see issues, confirm your browser version first.

faqs.question: How do refunds work?
faqs.answer: Refund rules differ by customer type: terms mention consumers can request a pro-rated refund within 15 days, while help text states purchases are non-cancelable and non-refundable for customers. If refunds matter, confirm whether you're treated as a consumer or business customer.

faqs.question: How do I cancel a subscription?
faqs.answer: Terms describe renewal notice timing (at least 5 days prior for automatic renewal). If you're on annual billing, don't wait until the last day to review renewal status. Check current account UI for exact cancellation steps.

faqs.question: Why do some scripts get rejected?
faqs.answer: User reports: moderation can be strict and sometimes unclear, leading to rejected scripts. Keep wording neutral, avoid harassment/bullying framing, and remove risky phrasing if blocked.

faqs.question: Why does rendering sometimes get stuck at 99%?
faqs.answer: User reports: generation can stall near completion and may require retrying. If it repeats, check browser requirements and simplify the project.
